intro: Sisyrinchium alatum var. minus, commonly known as the narrowleaf blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and delicate blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a desirable plant for rock gardens and xeriscaping. It is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
